description: Transforms research findings into organized, actionable parenting insights with SPECIFIC actions parents can take, formatted for email delivery with topic sections

result.introduction: Welcome to this month's digest of the latest parenting science research, translated into actions you can take today.

findings.research_summary: Recent longitudinal study found that consistent bedtime routines between 7-8pm were associated with 40% fewer behavioral issues in preschool-aged children compared to irregular sleep schedules.
findings.actionable_implication: Set a consistent bedtime routine between 7-8pm for children under 5, including the same sequence of activities each night (bath, story, song, lights out).

findings.research_summary: Meta-analysis of 25 studies showed that children consuming omega-3 fatty acids 2-3 times per week demonstrated improved cognitive performance and focus in classroom settings.
findings.actionable_implication: Include omega-3 rich foods like salmon, sardines, or walnuts in your child's diet 2-3 times per week, aiming for 250-500mg of combined EPA/DHA for children ages 4-8.

findings.research_summary: Large-scale study of 5,000 children found that limiting recreational screen time to 1 hour per day was associated with better social skills and lower anxiety levels in children ages 2-5.
findings.actionable_implication: Limit recreational screen time to 1 hour per day for children ages 2-5, and ensure screens are turned off at least 1 hour before bedtime.

result.closing_message: Remember: Small, consistent actions make the biggest difference in your child's development. Start with one change this week!

update_reason: Enhanced to require SPECIFIC actionable implications with numbers, times, and frequencies instead of vague advice
